page.title: 01HEMEL HEMPSTEAD INTRODUCTION
page.content: Since Hemel Hempstead was developed as a New Town in the 1950s, the old and new communities have become integrated. As intended the new neighbourhoods with basic amenities centrally placed have acquired their own characters. All the houses were built to high standards and different types were mixed in an attempt to improve social integration, but some areas are deemed to be more desirable than others. The town centre has the water gardens, free parking, wide pavements and many shops but high rates have forced some to close. The market flourishes and is noted for fruit and vegetables. People often shop in Watford, Brent Cross and Milton Keynes. Culturally the town depends on London but has a Pavilion,Sports Centre and F.E.College which provide activities of many kinds
